column1: Neunkirchen (German: [ˈnɔɪ̯nˌkɪʁçn̩] (listen)) is a Kreis (district) in the middle of the Saarland
column2: Germany. Neighboring districts are Sankt Wendel
the district Ottweiler was created; however
column3: its history can be traced back to 1545 when it was created as Herrschaft Ottweiler
column5: and during the Napoleonic times as Kanton Ottweiler. Two years after its creation
column6: it was reorganized in 1816 by order of the Congress of Vienna. In 1866
column7: an attempt to move the district capital to Neunkirchen failed. In 1974
column9: the biggest change however was the change of the capital and thus the name to Neunkirchen. Some parts of the administration remained in Ottweiler.

column1: The entire district is located in the industrial area
column2: which is centered in Saarbrücken. It is situated on either bank of the Blies
column3: a major tributary of the Saar River.
